[1] Air quality assessment took place in the town of Viseu during the four previously mentioned periods. [2] The measured outdoor parameters included ambient air concentrations of O3, NO, NO2, CO and BTEX (benzene, toluene, ethylbenzene and xylenes), and particles with a 50% cut-off aerodynamic diameter of 10 Âµm and 2.5 Î¼m (PM10 and PM2.5, respectively), which were measured continuously in three mobile laboratories: in the city centre, the school courtyard of the urban location and a suburban school courtyard. [3] Additionally, at the urban school, both ambient PM10 and PM2.5 were measured by gravimetric methods (24-h mean) while for the suburban school only PM10 was measured, as only one set of equipment for PM2.5 was available. [4] O3 and NO2 concentrations were also measured using diffusive samplers located at 20 points throughout the city of Viseu, in an area of âˆ¼40 km2. [1] Volatile organic compound (VOC; such as formaldehyde and BTEX), O3 and NO2 measurements were performed in the four schools (courtyard and classrooms) and children's houses (bedrooms) using diffusive samplers.
